Having this come around a second time really showed how it's somewhat overrated. I'd love for it to be an annual game mode on April Fools Day, but I'm somewhat glad it isn't permanent. Thanks for letting us play it, RITO.

I would definitely like to see URF or even All for One come back and be a permanent thing. It brings variety to the game; URF is way more fun than ARAM, but it does get annoying when you see the same champions over and over again. Why not just have an URF ARAM?!

So looking through a lot of the comments, I see some people already saying their goodbye's and their "Thanks rito!"'s, but others are saying that URF should stay and be a permanent game. Why not do both and make URF a custom only featured game-mode until April Fools day; where URF turns into a matchmaking featured game-mode?

the reason things like this dont work is because it requires dedicated servers to be running all the time then. Currently there are the servers that run SR, another set for TT, another for crystal scar, and another for ARAM. I imagine they also have a fifth set exclusively for featured game modes as well.

and thats not just in the US that is how it is at all the server locations around the world. To bring on an entirely new game mode you would have to have dedicated servers for that mode, even if it was only playable in a custom game.
The solution is very simple. Replace Crystal Scar with URF. It just makes sense.⌐▄-▄

I must disagree with putting Urf away. Sure- it might get old, and is completely unbalanced, but the game-mode's biggest weaknesses are it's greatest strengths. Being able to flash on command, and spam abilities makes you feel empowered. If you think you should put away a fun game mode on the sole purpose of "it gets old" then I got something for you; don't play it if you're not in the mood to. The best course of action is to leave the game mode available just like the other game mode services. It's there when you want it, and for people that strictly play the game for Urf too. I know a lot of people play strictly bot games, and that's completely fine with me, and shouldn't be catered to only Summoner's Rift casual, and competitive players.
